course.subject: HUMA
course.name: Structure of the Chinese Language
course.description: This course introduces basic concepts in linguistics such as consonant, vowel, morpheme, concepts which help students to describe and analyze the structure of the Chinese language, with emphasis on sounds and grammar. Moreover, similarities and differences among major Chinese dialects such as Mandarin, Yue, Min, Hakka, Wu, etc, and between Chinese and other languages will be highlighted. Furthermore, characteristics of the non-Han languages spoken in the neighboring areas will be compared with those of the Chinese dialects in order to highlight the bi-directional influences between Chinese and the non-Han languages, influences which help shape these languages.

æ”¹å·å°‘å°‘æ…¢;ä¿¾åˆ†/å•±éŒ¯æ—¢å®šç¾©æœ‰æ™‚å¹¾æ¨¡ç³Š
reviews.comment_workload:
5 Quizzes - based on 5 big topics

1 Assignment - it's okay once you pay attention in the lesson (except the bonus marks, LI expects no one can get extra marks)
it's not difficult but make sure you have enough time to finish it (100+ street names searching)

1 HW - just the IPA transcriptions of A-Z, which is super easy

overall, I think the workload is not heavy

reviews.author: Sooooo
reviews.title: Common core with horrible workload
reviews.comment_content:
IPA, word formation, word class, sentence structure, mainly focused on Chinese (mandarin and cantonese)

If u are interested in linguistics, it might be interesting for you
but if not, then you might find it very difficult and have to memorize very painfully...
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is quite nice, but then it is also quite boring when listening to him. And he sometimes made mistakes and have ambiguous marking standards for the quizzes. The prof is also not very good at explaining the concepts very precisely and clearly, not until students raised questions regarding those concepts. But generally speaking, he's quite willing to discuss and answer all the questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
Not yet received a grade, but heard the grade was generally ok.
Basically, not many people are expert in linguistics, so not especially competitive regarding the grades. Study more then you can outperform in the quizzes.

5 quizzes - 35%
Assignment - 10%
Attendance - 10%
Final Exam - 45%
reviews.comment_workload:
As a common core course with 3 credits, this course is definitely with a very horrible workload.
There are quizzes once every 1.5 -2 weeks, and all were taken during the mid-term period, making life ridiculously stressful.
The assignment also required us to submit over 100 words examples, which in fact, quite demanding as an assignment of a common core course.
In addition, there's still a final exam that covers the topics of the whole semester, which is a heavily loaded coverage :o)
So if you are not ready for memorizing and for a heavy workload, don't take this course ^^

reviews.author: _Daniel
reviews.title: Insightful knowledge about the Chinese langauge you won't get to learn easily on the web
reviews.comment_content:
Basic introduction to Phonology, Morphology and Lexicology. You will learn how to read IPA, quite a useful tool for learning other languages.

The overall course syllabus is interesting if you like linguistics and history. For example, you will learn about the changes of the various dialects of the Chinese language through time, and how experts reconstruct Old Chinese pronunciations through rhyme books, and other languages such as Japanese and old transcriptions of place names like Alexandra of the Roman Empire. Cantonese also has common loanwords from the Zhuang language, which as a native speaker, I have never known and is nice to know.

However, I believe some materials isn't absolutely "scientific". For example, answers to dissection/analysis of Chinese sentences/words relies heavily on the instructor's impression (èªæ„Ÿ), even though he could not quite explain the rules of his reasoning. Learning his way is quite like machine learning: I don't know the reasons behind the choices, so I'll make up some more examples and iteratively try to fit into his modal answers.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The course should have been taught in English. However, some lectures contain much Chinese examples, like words, phrases or special terminology that the instructor felt he'd rather teach the entire lecture in Mandarin.

The pace is quite fine, each lecture starts with some quick summary from the previous lecture.
reviews.comment_grading:
My grade was good. The final grade consists of 4 highest scores out of 5 quizzes, the final exam (quiz) on Canvas and one assignment.

The questions of quizzes and the assignment is quite "magical", in that it is easy to miss sections of it. If your lecturer is Li, Dechao, do absolutely check your paper a few times reading every single word.
reviews.comment_workload:
The quizzes require some studying on lecture slides and contents is decided in ~1 week notice. Due to the "fuzziness" of the analysis, it's better to consult the instructor after class for clarifications for the topics/example in slides if you are not completely sure of the reasoning.

The assignment is quite long, but time if sufficient.

reviews.author: yukikcy
reviews.title: Heavy workload, not very good grade
reviews.comment_content: Many contents, need to recite so many things... final examination is accumulated.
reviews.comment_teaching: cant understand during lessons so i didnt attend the lessons except quiz
reviews.comment_grading:
score very high in all quiz, almost the highest
However, there is no result of the final exam. I do not have a range. Very disappointed
reviews.comment_workload:
heavy workload,
5 quiz,
and have 2 assignment
If you like recitation, then it's okay. everything is in the lecture notes so its okay when you cant understand lectures. But you always need to study for the quiz. and the assignment is very long

reviews.author: JJLLL
reviews.title: good grade course
reviews.comment_content: This course teaches some phonetics mainly in Chinese and Cantonese. Evolution of Chinese and Cantonese are included.
reviews.comment_teaching: Quite good but boring. The speaking tempo is slow but it is clear and easy understand
reviews.comment_grading: 3 of 5 quiz below mean, other 2 are above mean little bit. Final above mean 1/2 sd, get B at last
reviews.comment_workload: It is moderate in workload. 4-5 quiz each quiz include up to 2-3 slides. 2 assignment which is easily found in the internet. This is a memorising corse you need to memorise a lot of  phonetic and their change. However, the powerpoint contains some table to help you memorise it. so it is good to study.

reviews.author: cliffton
reviews.title: basic linguistic course
reviews.comment_content:
The content is mainly about phonetics, Morphology ,Syntax, characteristic of different  dialect in China and the evolution and characteristic of old Chinese and middle Chinese. It will be difficult to catch up if you miss one or two slide during the lesson. The course required you to understand basic usage of IPA, the initials and finals of  Mandarin and Cantonese, the word classes and grammar etc.
Some important concept of evolution of Mandarin and Cantonese will be tested likeâ€œå°–åœ˜åˆæµ and â€œæ¿ä¸Šè®Šå»â€
reviews.comment_teaching:
The instructor is boring and student will easily fall asleep if you are not paying extra attention.
Some topic if you are already familiar you can just skip the lesson and read the Powerpoint by your own
reviews.comment_grading:
quiz(30%) x 5(each 6%)
assignment(30%) x 2(each 15%)
final exam(40%)

Both assignment can be done simply by finding resource and using the translator that exist on Internet
reviews.comment_workload:
JUST memorize all the things in the slide.
There will be a review list in the last day of the course and just memorize it according to the instructions.
The assignment is easy to due with and all in all, the workload of this course is acceptable if you don't count the 5 quiz.

reviews.author: Kennethsiukk
reviews.comment_content:
Basically, the course involves
Phonology, Morphology, Syntax, and Grammar of Chinese which are the basic things for linguistic and the covered materials was not complicated at all.
There are 3 in-class quizzes, one assignment and one final.
She requires you to write an essay about "de" for the assignment. It would not be too difficult if you asked her questions.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The teaching was good as she can deliver good English.
She also provided some after class exercise for you to practice the things taught in class. They are very useful for the revision of the quizzes as they have the same format.
reviews.comment_grading:
very good grade

Quizzes score
1. 18/20
2. 73/84
3. 84/90

The exam is not too difficult with some long questions and some questions similar to the quizzes.
reviews.comment_workload: Fair. The readings are not required and it does not help with the examination and the quizzes and the projects. Just for your interest and information.

reviews.author: pwcheng
reviews.title: Recommended Linguistic Introduction Course
reviews.comment_content: The course introduces basic concepts in linguistics such as consonant, vowel and morpheme and the method to analyze Chinese language. Moreover, comparison on the grammar and sentence structure between different languages would be covered.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor is passionate in teaching and helpful in answering students' questions. She also uses concrete examples to explain the concepts and this makes the theories easier to understand.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is very good! I got an A in the grading which is out of my expectation.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload of this course is adequate and acceptable. There are quizzes after finishing each module and these help us to revise the concept involved. There is also one assignment before the final exam.
